snippet: “13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi,” directed by Michael Bay, is scheduled to hit theaters just two weeks before the Democratic caucuses in Iowa.
abstract: Michael Bay movie 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi, which is based on terrorist attack on United States diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, is set for release in January, just two weeks before Iowans caucus to determine their preferred presidential candidates; release date could complicatedHillary Rodham Clinton's bid for Democratic nominee, as event was one of most controversial during her time as secretary of state.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and AMY CHOZICK

lead_paragraph: “13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi,” directed by Michael Bay, is scheduled to hit theaters just two weeks before the Democratic caucuses in Iowa.

headline.main: Timing of Movie About Benghazi Attack Could Test Clinton in Iowa Caucuses
headline.print_headline: Timing of Movie About Benghazi Attack Could Test Clinton in Iowa

keywords.value: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi (Movie)
